thread.title: Princeton drops Panthers to 4-4

title: Princeton drops Panthers to 4-4
text:
Princeton drops Panthers to 4-4 
PRINCETON, Ill. â€” Princeton remained unbeaten and put Erie/Prophetstown's playoff hopes in peril with a 39-22 win Friday in Three Rivers Conference football. 
The win boosted Princeton, which is ranked fifth in the Illinois AP Class 3A ratings, to 8-0 on the season and 5-0 in the Mississippi Division). 
The loss dropped the Panthers to 4-4, 2-3. They must beat Hall next Friday and then hope they have enough playoff points (opponents' wins) to qualify for the postseason. Hall, ranked third in Class 2A, lost 22-21 to Sterling Newman on Friday. 
Dylan Binion ran the ball 22 times for 153 yards in the loss. He had 17 carries for 135 yards in the first half. 
The Tigers opened the scoring with a 23-yard pass from Jake Reinhardt to Levi Bates with 7 minutes, 21 seconds left in the first quarter and never looked back. 
A 14-yard run by Binion and a two-point conversion run by quarterback Phillip Coers brought the Panthers within 13-8 with 2:02 left in the first half, but Princeton scored twice in the third period to re-establish control. 
Jett Wedekind scored on a 31-yard pass from Reinhardt with 9:01 left, then Smith ran it in from 2 yards out to make it 25-8 with 4:28 left in the third period. 
Erie/Prophetstown pulled within 25-14 on a 31-yard run by Seth Cameron with 59 seconds left in the quarter, but Princeton put the game away in the fourth quarter. 
First, Wedekind scored on a 33-yard run, then, after Cameron scored from 22 yards out for E/P, Smith put the final touches on the win with a 15-yard TD run with 3:06 remaining. Sign Up / Sign In With your existing account from... {* loginWidget *}
